newsitem.title: USA: HBO to acquire Enterprise Systems in stock swap.
newsitem.headline: HBO to acquire Enterprise Systems in stock swap.

text.p: HBO & Co., a healthcare services provider, said Friday it agreed to acquire Enterprise Systems Inc., a provider of healthcare-related management services, in a stock swap valued at between approximately $243 million and $258 million.
The stock-swap ratio will depend on the average closing price of HBO stock for 20 trading days before the transaction's close.

If the average price is between $60 and $68, ESI shareholders will receive HBO stock equal to $30 for each ESI share. If the HBO average price is over $72, ESI holders will receive $31.77 worth of HBO stock for each ESI share.
Based on approximately 8.12 million ESI shares outstanding, the deal would be valued at between $243 million and $258 million.
HBO stock was down $1 at $53.875 and Enterprise Systems stock was down $2.75 at $24.875 in afternoon trading on Nasdaq.
Enterprise Systems, which develops resource management products for over 1,000 healthcare organisations in North America, had 1996 revenues of $52.3 million.
HBO produces healthcare management software as well as networking technologies and outsourcing services to healthcare organisations.
HBO said it expects the deal to close during the second quarter.
